text: A Lament for Doomed Tyre
And the word of Yahweh ⸤came⸥\f + \fr 27:1 \ft Literally “was” \f* to me, ⸤saying⸥,\f + \fr 27:1 \ft Literally “to say” \f*
“And you, son of man,\f + \fr 27:2 \ft Or “mortal,” or “son of humankind” \f* raise a lament against Tyre.
And you must say to Tyre, the one who sits at \add the\add* entrance of the sea \add as\add* the merchant of the peoples to the many coastlands, ‘Thus says the Lord Yahweh:
Tyre, ⸤you yourself said⸥\f + \fr 27:3 \ft Literally “you you said” \f*
“I \add am\add* perfect ⸤in beauty⸥!”\f + \fr 27:3 \ft Literally “of beauty” \f*
In \add the\add* heart of \add the\add* seas \add are\add* your boundaries;
your builders perfected your beauty.
They built \add with\add* pine trees from Senir
all of your boards for you;
they took cedars from Lebanon
to make a sailing mast ⸤for you⸥.\f + \fr 27:5 \ft Literally “on you” \f*
They made your oars
\add with\add* oaks from Bashan;
your deck they made \add with\add* inlaid ivory,
with cypress trees from the coastlands of Cyprus.\f + \fr 27:6 \ft According to the reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ) \f*
Your sail was fine linen with colorful weaving from Egypt
⸤to serve as a banner for you⸥;\f + \fr 27:7 \ft Literally “to be for you as a banner” \f*
blue and purple cloth from the coastlands of Cyprus\f + \fr 27:7 \ft Or “Elishah” \f*
was your awning.
The inhabitants of Sidon and Arvan
were your rowers;
your ⸤skilled men⸥,\f + \fr 27:8 \ft Literally “wise men” \f* O Tyre, were ⸤from your own people⸥,\f + \fr 27:8 \ft Literally “in you” \f*
\add and\add* they \add were\add* your seamen.
The elders of Gebal and its ⸤skilled men⸥\f + \fr 27:9 \ft Literally “wise men” \f* were ⸤among you⸥\f + \fr 27:9 \ft Literally “in you” \f*
\add as\add* the repairers of \add the\add* seam of your boat;
all of the ships of the sea and their mariners were ⸤among you⸥\f + \fr 27:9 \ft Literally “in you” \f*
to barter your wares.
Persia and Lud and Put
were ⸤among your soldiers⸥;\f + \fr 27:10 \ft Literally “in your army \fq as \ft the men of war your” \f*
small shield and helmet hung ⸤among you⸥\f + \fr 27:10 \ft Literally “in you” \f*
\add and\add* gave \add to you\add* your adornment.
The people\f + \fr 27:11 \ft Or “children,” or “sons” \f* of Arvan and Helech
\add were\add* on your walls all around,
and Gammadites
were in your towers.
They hung their quivers\f + \fr 27:11 \ft Or “shields” (cf. NJPS; NIV) \f* on your walls all around;
they perfected your beauty.
“ ‘Tarshish \add was\add* your trader; from \add the\add* abundance of all of \add their\add* wealth, with silver, iron, tin, and lead they exchanged for your merchandise.
Javan, Tubal, and Meshech were your traders; ⸤in exchange for people⸥\f + \fr 27:13 \ft Or “for a human person/soul” \f* and an object of bronze they gave \add you\add* your wares.
From Beth Togarmah they exchanged horses and war horses and mules for your wares.

The people\f + \fr 27:15 \ft Or “children” \f* of Dedan \add were\add* trading \add with\add* you, many coastlands \add composed\add* the region of your ⸤influence⸥;\f + \fr 27:15 \ft Literally “hand” \f* they brought back horns of ivory and ebony \add as\add* your payment.

Edom\f + \fr 27:16 \ft Reading Edom for Aram \f* \add was\add* trading \add with\add* you because of the abundance of your products, \add trading\add* with malachite, purple wool yarn and colorful weaving, and fine white fabric and black corals and rubies; \add all these\add* they exchange for your merchandise.
Judah and the land of Israel \add were\add* trading \add with\add* you with wheat from Minnith and millet and honey and olive oil and balm; \add all these\add* they gave \add for\add* your wares.

Damascus \add was\add* trading \add with\add* you ⸤because of⸥\f + \fr 27:18 \ft Literally “for” \f* the abundance of your products, because of the abundance of all of \add your\add* wealth, \add trading\add* with the wine of Helbon and white wool.
Vedan and Javan from Uzal, they exchanged wrought iron, cinnamon,\f + \fr 27:19 \ft Or “cassia” \f* and reed spice for your merchandise; \add all this\add* was for your wares.
Dedan \add was\add* trading \add with\add* you, with garments of woven material for riding.

Arabia and all of the leaders of Kedar \add were\add* ⸤your customers⸥;\f + \fr 27:21 \ft Literally “traders of your hand” \f* with young rams and \add adult\add* rams and goats \add they were\add* trading with them with you.

The traders of Sheba and Raamah \add were\add* trading \add with\add* you, with the finest of every spice and with every precious stone and gold; they exchanged \add all these\add* for your merchandise.
Haran and Canneh and Eden, the traders of Sheba, Assyria, \add and\add* Kilmad \add were\add* trading \add with\add* you.

They \add were\add* trading \add with\add* you in finery, in mantles of blue cloth and colorful embroidered work and with rugs of variegated cloth in twisted cords and knotted tightly; ⸤these were among your merchandise⸥.\f + \fr 27:24 \ft Literally “in your trading/marketplace” (cf. NET) \f*
The ships of Tarshish \add were\add* carrying \add for\add* you your wares, and you were filled, and you became very heavy in \add the\add* heart of \add the\add* seas.
“ ‘Into many waters
the rowers brought you;
\add but\add* ⸤the east wind⸥\f + \fr 27:26 \ft Literally “the wind of the east” \f* wrecked you
in \add the\add* heart of \add the\add* seas.
Your wealth and your merchandise, your wares,
your mariners, and your seamen,
your shipwrights\f + \fr 27:27 \ft Literally “the repairers/strengtheners of your seams” \f* and the barterers of your wares
and all of ⸤your soldiers⸥\f + \fr 27:27 \ft Literally “the men of your war” \f* who \add are\add* in you,
along\f + \fr 27:27 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* with all of your crew who are in the midst of you,
they will fall in \add the\add* heart of \add the\add* seas on the day of your downfall.
At the sound of the shout\f + \fr 27:28 \ft Or “cry” \f* of your seamen,
\add the\add* pasturelands will shake.
And they will go down from their ships,
all of \add those\add* holding an oar,
mariners, all of the seamen of the sea
will stand on the land,
and they will lament\f + \fr 27:30 \ft Hebrew “lamented” \f* over you with their voice,
and they will cry out\f + \fr 27:30 \ft Hebrew “cried out” \f* bitterly,
and they will throw\f + \fr 27:30 \ft Hebrew “threw” \f* dust on their heads,
\add and\add* they will roll\f + \fr 27:30 \ft Hebrew “rolled” \f* in the dust.
⸤They will shave themselves bald for your sake⸥,\f + \fr 27:31 \ft Literally “And they made bald for you \fq with \ft baldness” \f*
and they will dress\f + \fr 27:31 \ft Hebrew “dressed” \f* themselves \add in\add* sackcloth,
and they will weep\f + \fr 27:31 \ft Hebrew “wept” \f* over you with \add a\add* bitterness of soul\f + \fr 27:31 \ft Or “\fq of their \ft inner self” \f*
\add and\add* with bitter wailing.
And they will raise\f + \fr 27:32 \ft Hebrew “raised” \f* over you with their wailing a lament,
and they will chant\f + \fr 27:32 \ft Hebrew “chanted” \f* a lament over you:
‘Who is like Tyre,
like \add this\add* destruction in the midst of the sea?’
When your merchandise went out from \add the\add* seas,
you satisfied many peoples with the abundance of your wealth,
and \add by\add* your wares
you made rich \add the\add* kings of \add the\add* world.
Now you are broken by seas
in \add the\add* depths of waters;
your wares and all of your crew
in the midst of you have sunk.
All of the inhabitants of the coastlands
are appalled over you,
and their kings ⸤shudder⸥\f + \fr 27:35 \ft Literally “they have bristling hair” \f* \add in\add* horror;
⸤they distort their faces⸥!\f + \fr 27:35 \ft Literally “they are distorted \fq as to \ft faces” \f*
The traders among the peoples hiss over you;
you have become \add a\add* horror,
and ⸤you shall be no more forever⸥!’ ”\f + \fr 27:36 \ft Literally “there is not you until eternity/endless ages” (cf. NRSV) \f*
